property.value: Ramp: init == 0 ==> False else ==> True step connected ==> same as step property

property.name: text
property.value: Scale: init == 0 ==> False else ==> same as Input

property.name: text
property.value:
This example shows a simple example on how to annotate properties using a constraint solver algorithm.
Initially the system knows the properties for Ramps and Scales. All other properties are resolved by the constraint solver. The constraints are expressed as a logical AND, e.g. if properties of all inputs are True ==> properties of outputs = True
Author: Thomas Mandl, Man-Kit Leung

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

entity.name: Ramp2
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

property.name: text
property.value: Scale: init == 0 ==> False else ==> same as Input
